text: and if I have to take it into expiration at a loss that's okay but as long as it's within a reasonable bounce so that I'm not holding on to something that's running away so in this specific instance I didn't use a percent credit received like a lot of people like to do I simply use the data on recent movements to create thresholds for me to observe and then essentially to exit the trade if these ever get to essentially like a five times loss I'm getting out that's absolute worst case scenario just to create some sort of significant threshold I pretty much never hold to that point because I know I'm wrong before then if I see this start trending in one way or another I very frequently will exit but the problem is the markets the the way they've been trading and this way the context is so important because if you look at the way that the markets literally have been trading essentially since February it's these intraday trending movements notice how big these candles are so all of that is baked into the specific profit and loss management approach that I take here and this is why I needed to give it room to move and it's exactly why I simply was going to use the ADR ATR if it started to exceed ATR it's probably time to get out might give it a little bit more room to move but I've traded

text: and this is why I needed to give it room to move and it's exactly why I simply was going to use the ADR ATR if it started to exceed ATR it's probably time to get out might give it a little bit more room to move but I've traded these enough that I trust myself to execute accurately if you're a new Trader that can be really dangerous because we get super emotional and we start to make mistakes I am not exactly in that bucket because I've been doing this for a minute but that's exactly how I went about planning the Lost side of the trade so what does this come out to about a three thousand one hundred thirty dollar return which is a 0.53 return on invested capital I think I might have told you guys I made four grand so sorry I lied to you um it's 31 30. and somebody might be saying oh wow that kind of sucks only 0.53 return on invested Capital first of all this was in a single day so again if you annualize that return it's 589 let's not say I'm going to do this every single day but people have this awful habit of not understanding the context of percentages and raw numbers and it leads to these really skewed insane expectations because most of you guys are too busy seeing people on Twitter and on YouTube talking about 50x in your money in two days

text: this in the Discord a few days ago on several that went wrong it's important to realize that you do need a decent sample size for this to actually materialize because if we have Smart implied volatility calculations and the market essentially meets that expectation the trade's not going to make much if any money probably be a small loss so those instances happen pretty regularly but the cool part is even though people get really scared about things like short straddles because it's unrealized loss potential or an undefined loss potential it still tends to be okay and it's because of the same exact function that implied volatility pricing tends to be pretty good and if it's off it's not typically off by a hundred percent which is the kinds of moves you would need to have like just absolutely catastrophic losses on these especially if you're asleep at the wheel and the last thing I will say is that if you choose to put on these kinds of strategies you got to be around you got to watch it this is not my typical set and forget let me come back at the end of the day and see what it did because I don't have hard manual stops placed at a given point in time I need to pay attention because if I do not pay attention and that starts to Trend or we start to get a big move I expose myself to massive asymmetric downside
